abstract: The decision by Japan to choose Lockheed Martin’s F-35 jet as its next main fighter reflected a desire to tighten its ties with the United States in the face of concerns over China and North Korea.
snippet: The decision by Japan to choose Lockheed Martin’s F-35 jet as its next main fighter reflected a desire to tighten its ties with the United States in the face of concerns over China and North Korea.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Japan said on Tuesday that it had chosen Lockheed Martin’s F-35 jet as its next main fighter, a lift for the American defense contractor and for Tokyo’s relations with the United States amid heightened fears of instability on the Korean peninsula after the death of Kim Jong-il.

headline.main: Japan Picks Lockheed to Build Its Next Fighter Jet
headline.print_headline: Japan Selects Lockheed To Supply New Fighters
